ca.cgjennings.spelling

Class MultilanguageSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.MultilanguageSupport

  • public class MultilanguageSupport
extends Object
    This is a utility class that supports multiple shared spelling checkers for applications that use multiple languages simultaneously. Checkers can be loaded on demand.

    The checker for a given language may unload itself at any time to free up memory unless there is a reference to it somewhere in your application.

    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • changeChecker

        public static void changeChecker(JTextComponent tc,
                                 SpellingChecker sc)
        Parameters:
        tc - the text component to update
        sc - the new spelling checker to set
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the component or checker is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component does not have spelling checking installed

      • changeLocale

        public static void changeLocale(JTextComponent tc,
                                Locale loc)
                         throws IOException
        Changes the locale of a text component that has a spelling checker attached. The component will use the spelling checker returned by getChecker(java.util.Locale) for the requested locale to check spelling.
        Parameters:
        tc - the text component to update
        loc - the new locale to set
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the component or locale is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the component does not have spelling checking installed
        IOException - if a spelling checker must be created for the locale and there is an exception while loading the dictionaries

      • getChecker

        public static SpellingChecker getChecker(Locale loc)
                                  throws IOException
        Returns a spelling checker for the requested locale. If necessary, a new checker will be created and the standard dictionaries for the language will be loaded. If there is no support for the language of the requested locale, a spelling checker will be returned that accepts all words. (This prevents a text field from turning into one long red squiggle when you set an unsupported locale on it.)
        Parameters:
        loc - locale to obtain a checker for
        Returns:
        a checker for the best-matching locale, or a dummy checker that accepts all words
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs loading the data for the locale

      • getCheckerIfLoaded

        public static SpellingChecker getCheckerIfLoaded(Locale loc)
        Returns a hard reference to a spelling checker for the requested locale if the checker for the locale is currently loaded and available. If this returns null, then there is a checker available for the locale but it is not currently loaded, so there will be a significant delay if an instance is requested. This can be called to check if feedback should be displayed to the user before requesting a checker via getChecker(java.util.Locale).
        Parameters:
        loc - the locale to test
        Returns:
        the already-loaded checker if available

      • getDummyChecker

        public static SpellingChecker getDummyChecker()
        Returns a shared spelling checker that doesn't mark anything as incorrectly spelled. This can be used if a fallback in the event that an exception is thrown when loading the dictionaries for a language.
        Returns:
        a shared instance of a checker that marks all text as correct

      • getSupportedLocale

        public static Locale getSupportedLocale(Locale loc)
        Given a specific locale, returns the closest locale for which standard dictionaries are available, or null. For example, if you requested fr_CA (Canadian French), you might get back simply fr (French, with no particular region). Or, if no French dictionary was installed at all, null. This is provided for information purposes only: getChecker(java.util.Locale) will determine the best spelling checker to use automatically. If the returned locale is non-null, then it matches at least the language part of the locale of interest.
        Parameters:
        loc - the locale to check support for
        Returns:
        the locale with the best level of support for the locale, or null

      • isLocaleSupported

        public static boolean isLocaleSupported(Locale loc)
        Returns true if a standard dictionary is available for the precise locale. For example, if you request fr_CA then it would only return true if a specific French Canadian dictionary is available. If you want to know if a locale is supported at all, use getSupportedLocale( loc ) != null.
        Parameters:
        loc - the locale to check
        Returns:
        true if a standard dictionary for the specific locale is installed

      • setUsesSharedInstance

        public static void setUsesSharedInstance(boolean usesShared)
        Sets whether MultilanguageSupport will use the shared spelling checker when a specific locale is requested and the shared checker's locale satisfies the request. The default value is true. If you wish to change this value, you must do so before requesting any spelling checkers from this class.
        Parameters:
        usesShared - true if using the shared checker is allowed
